$GOOGL & $NVDA are deepening their partnership to anchor agentic AI inside Google Cloud.

This makes AI runnable where enterprise data actually lives and cheap enough to automate real workflows.

$MSFT has become one of Anthropic‚Äôs largest customers using Claude models across Microsoft products.

Spending was recently on pace to approach ~$500M annually and the irony is that this is exactly the role Copilot was supposed to dominate internally.

$TSM spent ~$200M to acquire ~900 acres next to its Arizona campus to secure land for future expansion.

The purchase supports TSMC‚Äôs $165B U.S. buildout plan that includes six fabs, advanced packaging facilities and an R&D center.

$TSLA will stop offering Full Self-Driving as a one-time purchase after February 14 and shift to a subscription-only model.

FSD will be priced at $99/month or $999/year, eliminating the ~$8K upfront option and turning autonomy into a recurring software cash machine.
This sits inside the X subscription since Savvy doesn‚Äôt support options and these are all options positions.

$EOSE just launched its next-gen Indensity zinc-based storage system targeting ~1 GWh per acre of energy density with ~ 4x traditional battery tech.

It‚Äôs built for long-duration storage in space-constrained environments like AI data centers.

China is telling domestic firms to stop using certain U.S. and Israeli cybersecurity software on national-security grounds. 

Names cited include $AVGO VMware, $PANW, $FTNT & $CHKP.

CRITICAL MINERALS CHEAT SHEET

The next phase of industrial policy, electrification, AI infra & defense spending is defined by input constraints with these companies sitting at the key supply-chain choke points: 

Rare Earth Elements
‚Ä¢ $MP controls the only scaled rare earth mining & processing asset in the U.S. 
‚Ä¢ $USAR building a domestic rare earth magnet supply chain to reduce reliance on China
‚Ä¢ $IDR focuses on U.S.-based rare earth & strategic mineral development tied to national security needs

Copper
‚Ä¢ $FCX largest publicly traded copper supplier to global infrastructure
‚Ä¢ $IE targets high-grade copper discoveries using proprietary geophysical technology to shorten development timelines

Lithium
‚Ä¢ $ALB largest global lithium supplier
‚Ä¢ $LAC anchors U.S. lithium supply through domestic projects

Antimony
‚Ä¢ $UAMY one of the only domestic antimony suppliers
‚Ä¢ $NVA provides antimony exposure alongside gold through U.S.-based projects

Multi-Resource & Strategic Supply
‚Ä¢ $CRML targets rare earths & defense-critical resources
‚Ä¢ $TMC focuses on battery metals sourced from polymetallic nodules as an alternative to land-based mining
‚Ä¢ $NB targets niobium, scandium & titanium

Graphite 
‚Ä¢ $NVX supplies synthetic graphite tied to North American battery manufacturing
‚Ä¢ $NMG develops vertically integrated graphite production outside China
‚Ä¢ $WWR targets U.S. graphite processing for EV supply chains
I expect $AMD revenue to ~3x over the next four years

In today's Early Look: "Sweeping Old Wall Street"

The Maori have a word "taonga," which means treasure. "The black jersey is a taonga‚Äîa sacred object symbolizing excellence, hard work, and a New Zealander's ability to become, with effort and sacrifice, the best in the world."

When you wake up in the morning, do you want to be the best in the world? Are you willing to put in the real work and sacrifice it takes? Can you do that alongside a loyal team of warriors for 20, 30, or God willing, 50 years?
Did I ‚Äúknow‚Äù with Old Wall ‚Äúconviction‚Äù that Silver and Platinum would go vertical for me? No. But I was certain about the process that positioned us to buy them when the signals fired

The best part about @Hedgeye  is even with all the information & data, I have to have a process that works for me and my objectives.  I use the Risk Range product to help me make trades, not just for "picks." Bitcoin being the most recent. The data supported my entry point
